column4: sorry if i'm being a bother, but this is a rather odd problem - i have sound modules loaded, lspci returns my proper sound card, but alsa just isn't seeing it
qubits - command not found, and couldn't find it with apt either
use asoundconf in a terminal and set default sound card, should be in your menu also
- what's the parameter for the card?
try asoundconf -list
- done that - the command is "asoundconf set-default-card PARAMETER"
try system/preferences/set default sound card, its easier
there is no "set default sound card", but the sound menu only lets me select the software backend (alsa/pulse/oss/etc)
try asoundconf list   drop the hyphen you'll see the devices
- returns none
lspci   does it show up
sure does
it was working after install, but it disappeared after i upgraded video drivers
asoundconf list  shows nothing!?
dmesg |less  look for it there or reboot
freaking video drivers!!  [expletives galore here]
indeed
i've found that others have had similar problems, but haven't found a solution that works for me. on a side note, 64 bit intrepid is much.... wonkier than 32
i wont put 8.10 on my 64 bit box anytime soon it works too good to break.
what version are you running?
on this box, 8.10, been dist upgrading it since buntu was invented
and your 64 bit?
the 64 bit is still 8.04 hardy and java/flash ff-64 work great with sound, dvd et al
yes you can modprobe module  good to go
